[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/proof_simulation.rs] [Function: generate_random_scalar()] [Infinite Loop DoS] If from_random_bytes() consistently returns None due to malformed RNG state or specific byte patterns, does the while loop cause indefinite blocking that could freeze keyless authentication operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/proof_simulation.rs] [Function: generate_random_scalar()] [Information Leakage] Does the rejection sampling in the while loop leak timing information about the scalar generation process through variable iteration counts, enabling side-channel attacks to extract trapdoor secrets? [File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/proof_simulation.rs] [Function: generate_random_g1_elem()] [Weak Point Generation] Can an attacker exploit the 32-byte random sampling for G1 elements to bias point distribution, potentially creating weak generators that compromise proof soundness? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/proof_simulation.rs] [Function: generate_random_g1_elem()] [Point at Infinity] Does from_random_bytes() properly reject the point at infinity, or can it return the identity element that would make all subsequent cryptographic operations trivial and forgeable? [File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/proof_simulation.rs] [Function: generate_random_g1_elem()] [Subgroup Attack] Are the randomly generated G1 points validated to be in the correct subgroup, or can low-order points be generated that enable small subgroup attacks on the pairing verification? [File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/proof_simulation.rs] [Function: generate_random_scalar()] [Modular Reduction] Does ScalarField::from_random_bytes() perform constant-time modular reduction, or can timing variations reveal information about the generated scalar's magnitude? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/proof_simulation.rs] [Function: generate_random_g1_elem()] [Invalid Curve Points] Can malformed random bytes cause from_random_bytes() to generate points not on the BN254 curve, leading to undefined behavior in subsequent pairing operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/proof_simulation.rs] [Function: circuit_agnostic_setup_with_trapdoor()] [Zero Trapdoor Attack] Can any of the randomly generated trapdoor scalars (alpha, beta, gamma, delta) be zero, making the inverse operation panic and creating a DoS vulnerability? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/proof_simulation.rs] [Function: circuit_agnostic_setup_with_trapdoor()] [G2 Generator Weakness] Is the G2 generator constructed by multiplying the standard generator by a random scalar, potentially creating a weak generator that doesn't span the entire group?
